result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J. Schroeder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter J. Schroeder was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:26 AM Defendant Peter J. Schroeder in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Allen advises the request is for waiver of costs and continued probation.  Court enters judgment on Ct 2:  costs waived.  No further probation or sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Schroeder present.  ADa Johnson present. BW ordered vacated.  Court hears all parties.  DPA continues to be revoked;  Sentencing on 10/24/2019 at 11:30.
State appears by Curt Johnson.  State has no proof of community service or anger managment class.  State wants to revok DPA.  DPA is revoked.  Bench warrant ordered.
Status conference on September 17, 2019 at 11:00 am.

Community service has been complied with.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2019 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter J. Schroeder in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Ct 1.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.    State recites joint recommendation: 12 mo DPA.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.    No contest plea given.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and defers sentence to allow completion of the DPA.
